speaker: MR. VAN DE KAMP
line: Easy there, hon. You're cleaning so hard I'm afraid you're going to stick the dog in the dishwasher.

speaker: MR. VAN DE KAMP
line: Hey. Come on, now. Quit it. This is what we dreamed about. What we prayed for

speaker: MRS. VAN DE KAMP
line: I know. I'm sorry.

speaker: MRS. VAN DE KAMP
line: I just can't stop wondering why. Why give up a child? Give it up to strangers?

speaker: MR. VAN DE KAMP
line: God has his reasons and his ways.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER 1
line: Mr. and Mrs. Van de Kamp. Hi. This was so hard to find.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER 1
line: I'm so sorry but there's a page here that didn't get signed. If I can just get you to do that now. Here we go. Okay. Right there.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
line: Thanks.

speaker: MRS. VAN DE KAMP
line: I keep asking myself a question. I know there's been a medical exam... but are you sure he's okay?

speaker: MR. VAN DE KAMP
line: Now, honey.

speaker: MRS. VAN DE KAMP
line: Why would the mother give him up?

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER 1
line: You should understand... this was a life choice by a single mother and a terribly difficult decision for her. But I can say it was only for the good of the child.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
line: I want you to meet William.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They don't pay me enough.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right there! Hands in the air!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Turn around and step forward.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Step forward.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let's go, tough guy! All the way down!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Reyes.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do we know who he is?

speaker: REYES
line: He says his name is Miller but he has no identification on him. Beyond that, we don't know a lot.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why are the lights off?

speaker: REYES
line: He wouldn't speak with them on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: REYES
line: If you saw him in the light, you'd understand. Something's wrong with his face. He's been severely burned by fire or maybe acid.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And he says he knows me?

speaker: REYES
line: And that he's afraid. A victim of what he calls the alien conspiracy.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You won't talk to me. You going to talk to her, Mr. Miller?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: If she'll help me and protect me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You better hope she's feeling more charitable than I am, partner.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully. He's under arrest for assaulting a federal officer. I've explained to him the penalties but he still refuses a lawyer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did he get in the building?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We found a card key on him. Says it was given to him by Fox Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His name is Miller?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Daniel Miller of Fredericksburg. He gave us an address but we're still working on the confirmation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I came here to find answers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Answers to what?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: To this. What they did to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From your scarring, it appears that you've been burned. Are you claiming that someone burned you and that there is evidence here to incriminate them?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: According to Fox Mulder, the men who did this are part of a government conspiracy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Go on.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: You know who these men are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did Mulder tell you that, too?

speaker: SCULLY
line: When?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: If I were to tell you that, you might use the information to find him. Mulder doesn't want to be found.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: When I searched him I found those X-Files stuffed inside his clothes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know who that is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's his sister.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Whose?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: Mulder's. She was abducted from her home when she was a little girl -- part of this same government conspiracy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You seem to know a lot, Mr. Miller. It gives an impression either that you are telling the truth or you just want us to believe that you are.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: If I thought you'd believe me, I wouldn't have snuck in here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett. Would you please arrange the transfer of this man to Quantico? I'd like to personally examine his injuries.

speaker: SCULLY
line: from the tissue quality, the scarring is fairly recent... the extent of it severe but it's not from burning or chemicals.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it, then?

speaker: REYES
line: Mr. Miller?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I was injected.

speaker: [QUICK FLASHBACK
line: A hand holding a hypodermic needle. A man strapped down naked in an examining chair. The needle slowly approaching. Three men in which lab coats surrounding the man in the chair. A large overhead examining light above the chair. Metal clamps holding the man's mouth open. The hypodermic needle being inserted in the man's neck. The man's hand griping the chair's arm rest in pain and another hand physically holding it down. ]

speaker: SCULLY
line: Injected with what?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I don't know. It burned. Throughout my whole body inside and out.

speaker: [QUICK FLASHBACK
line: Back in the room. The needle injecting something into the man's neck. The mouth clamps used to keep his mouth open. Three men in white lab coats surrounding the naked man strapped in the examining chair. The man writhes in pain. His head thrashing from side to side. Needle injection into the man's neck. The scarred hand gripping the arm rest. The men in lab coats standing by the man in the examining chair. The mouth clamp. The hand physically holding the man's hand down. Mouth clamp. Pain.]

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, Agent Reyes. I need to speak to you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I've been out running this man's supposed ID. There's seven Daniel Millers in Fredericksburg but I can tell you, he isn't one of them.

speaker: REYES
line: Then who is he?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I got an idea but you're not going to believe it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, who is he?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You asked him how he got in the FBI -- how he knows what he knows.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He said that he contacted Agent Mulder -- that Mulder told him...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't think so. I don't think Mulder told him anything. I think that how he got in here and the reason he knows what he knows is because that man in there is Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's ridiculous. It's absurd.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is it? What is true and what we want to be true aren't always the same.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm telling you, that's not Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I hope you prove me wrong.

speaker: [QUICK FLASHBACK
line: A scarred face close up. Head thrashing from side to side. The man in a white lab coat wearing an executioner-like black mask over his entire head approaching the man in the chair. One man in a white lab coat in the room with the naked man in the examining chair. Mouth clamp and head thrashing from side to side. A scarred hand gripping the arm chair rest. Close-up of a hypodermic needle. Three men in white lab coats surrounding the chair. Needle injection. Mouth clamp. Scarred hand being held down. The man in a white lab coat wearing an executioner- like black mask over his entire head. The man slowly pulls off the black mask over his head... the mask slowly comes off... ]

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you open your mouth, sir? I need to look at your dental work.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: You're not going to tell me I need braces, are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now your eyes.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: Are you going to help me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you going I don't know how I can.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: Help me make them pay for this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You, uh... refer to them as if I know them or know where they are.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: They did terrible things to you, too, when you were abducted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, you've given us a false name. We know that your name is not Daniel Miller.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: No, it's not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I can't say.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why lie to us, if you want us to help you?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: Because there are people working here at the FBI who would kill me if they knew I was being held here. The same people who would kill Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can put your clothes back on.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I'm asking for your help. But I might be able to help you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How can you help me?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: You're looking for answers, too.

speaker: [MULDER
line: We're both looking for answers.]

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not him. It's not Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're absolutely sure of that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. And so will we all be once you bring me back his DNA tests.

speaker: REYES
line: What do we do with him now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, admittedly he's lying about who he is but the danger to him may be real. I think we need to figure out what it is that he wants and then see if he lies about that, too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How are we going to do that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, first, I think we need to quietly get him back to D.C. To FBI headquarters.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You came here looking for something. What is it that you hope to find?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I didn't find it.

speaker: REYES
line: You stole several files pertaining to the 1973 abduction of Mulder's sister. But yet you say there's danger to your life right now.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: The conspiracy to keep the truth about aliens from the American public all but destroyed a few years ago has given rise to a new conspiracy in the government now by men who are alien themselves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what does this have to do with you?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: What you can see they did to me was a failed attempt to turn me into one of these alien men. I was a guinea pig -- a test subject. And now I want to expose their evil plans.

speaker: REYES
line: What plans are those?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: To do this to you... to everyone. Mulder said there were files here -- cases like mine. He gave me names and case numbers but I don't see them. They're not here. Someone's already removed them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: REYES
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is what you're looking for.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: You trust me? Thank you.

speaker: REYES
line: What are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Proving Agent Doggett wrong. That that's not Mulder in there.

speaker: REYES
line: How? I don't understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder and I agreed to take those files out of the X-Files office and leave them here for safekeeping. Mulder would have known where they were. And that man in there didn't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get away from the crib!

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: The baby was crying...

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's none of your business!

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I'm sorry. I'd heard so much about William. Mulder told me how he missed him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if that's true, then where the hell is he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just tell me where he is!

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: You don't want to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to know.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: He's in pain. Terrible pain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then let me go to him.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: There's nothing you can do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not for you to decide.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: You know as well as I that's Mulder's decision. I... he begged me to honor it. For your safety... and William's.

speaker: REYES
line: Here, Dana, let me take him for you.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: No.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: Please. May I?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I want to hold him.

speaker: REYES
line: Mr. Miller...

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: No, it's important I do this. I want to hold him for Mulder.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: He's so beautiful.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Assistant Director. You said you've spoken to the lab.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I got some advance info on the exam that Scully performed on the man.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The blood type matches Mulder's but there are aspects of the physiology that aren't a match.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Such as?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, the body mass, of course. He's shorter and weighs considerably less than Mulder did.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You haven't seen this guy -- what they've done to him. They way he's twisted, he's like an old man. He could be a hundred years old.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm just relaying the facts. And the fact is he's not a hundred years old, is he? Not the way he attacked you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, whoever he is, he wants something.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He says he wants revenge against the people that burned him. And Mulder directed him to the place where he could find the files and the people who did it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That doesn't make any sense. Mulder knows those files inside out. Why would he direct him? Why not just tell him?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Skinner. Yeah. You're sure about that? All right.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That was the lab. They were able to rush the PCR test and they came up with a definitive DNA result.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What is it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where is this man right now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's all been a good act.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I don't know what you mean.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you do. You knew those files were here. You just pretended not to know.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want the truth from you.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: What truth?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The truth that you won't speak.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I want the same truth you do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't do this to me. Not you.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I didn't come here to upset you. I didn't plan on being caught. I know you must have a hard life living alone raising a son not knowing whether you'll see Mulder again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know my life?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: I know what Mulder knows. I know they used you to create the child. I know they continue to use you to take care of it and raise it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you saying?

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: You know what I'm saying. Your son -- your child is part alien.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just tell me who you are. Come on, just say your name. Say it! Just say it!

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: This was a private conversation.

speaker: REYES
line: I understand. I'm sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know who that man is?

speaker: REYES
line: Yes, I do.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is this? What?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We got DNA results. A positive ID.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not him. He wouldn't say these things.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The DNA's a match to Fox Mulder'S.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can we get you anything?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, thank you. I just need a minute.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where'd he go?

speaker: REYES
line: I don't know. I'll go check the nursery.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica, stay with Scully!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No more running, Mulder. We're going to protect you now.

speaker: REYES
line: Give him some time.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're going to live, buddy.

speaker: THE BREATHER
line: Think that's going to scar?

speaker: REYES
line: We're going to talk, but first you're going to get some sleep.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what now?

speaker: REYES
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you want to do?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Keep it a secret, for starters.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's not going to be hard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nobody's ever going to believe that that's Mulder.

speaker: REYES
line: Somebody did this to him. Whoever that is is going to know it's him. I mean, that's what he's afraid of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If he's so afraid, then why did he run?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You still don't believe it's him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know a person in so many ways. Ways that a test can't even begin to know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, I'll be happy to run his DNA again for you but I don't have to tell you what a long shot it is. I mean, it came up a perfect match.

speaker: REYES
line: You asked why he'd run. Stop and think how hard this is for him. I mean, the way he looks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If that was Mulder, I wouldn't care.

speaker: REYES
line: But he cares. He has to.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Maybe he's ashamed. Of what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not just the way he looks but you let him go to protect him only he couldn't protect himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You believe that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know. We'll have a better sense when he wakes up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: it's okay.

speaker: REYES
line: Is he okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god, there's blood! Oh, my god!

speaker: REYES
line: There's blood on the sheets.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What'd he do? What'd he do to him?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Dr. Edwards?

speaker: DR. NEWMAN
line: I'm Dr. Newman. I'm going to take your baby.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's been injected with something.

speaker: DR. NEWMAN
line: Take him to trauma. rate slightly elevated. Skin is warm. Nondiaphoretic.

speaker: REYES
line: I spoke to another doctor, a woman -- Dr. Edwards.

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: I'm Whitney Edwards. Agent Reyes?

speaker: REYES
line: Yes. This is Dana Scully.

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: Do we have any idea what he's been injected with?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've no idea. I don't know. I don't know.

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: We're going to run some tests...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm a medical doctor, okay? Can I...

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: Good. Then you know what this is all about. You just need to sit tight for me and let us do our job.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What'd you do to him?! What'd you do?!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where'd you put it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is this it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is this what you used? Answer me!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Anything happens to that kid I'm going to take you out personally. I don't care who the hell you are. CUT TO BLACK.

speaker: REYES
line: Here she comes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is he? Is he all right?

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: He's good. He's doing fine.

speaker: REYES
line: Well, can she see him?

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: We have him in step down right now as a precaution but I think he'll be going home in no time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you find?

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: Nothing.

speaker: REYES
line: How could you find nothing? There would have to be something.

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: There's some slight bruising on the head where something clearly broke the skin, but... he's fine.

speaker: REYES
line: What about a tox screen?

speaker: DR. WHITNEY EDWARDS
line: There's an elevated amount of iron in his blood but other than that, your son is completely normal.

speaker: REYES
line: That doesn't make sense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No... I think it does. It makes perfect sense now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have seen my share of the hideous of the disgusting and the repellent, but you, sir, are the most perfect expression I will ever see of all that is vile and hateful in life.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: That may well be, but for a moment, you believed it -- that I was him

speaker: SCULLY
line: I never believed it.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: You wanted to believe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You are as false as your face.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I bet you wish night and day that that bullet that was meant to kill you had succeeded.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't believe this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who this is.

speaker: CUT BACK TO
line: nan

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: You're wrong about that. When I look in the mirror I see something much different than the world sees. He could destroy my face and my dignity when he shot me in that office...

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: ...but he couldn't destroy the one thing I love most -- my hatred of him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your cigarette-smoking, son of a bitch of a father.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: And Mulder's.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You counted on the DNA... that we'd buy it without question and not look any further. DNA's what Mulder shared with Jeffrey Spender.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: Ah.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: Half brothers raised apart -- that's about all that Mulder and I ever shared.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You haven't seen Mulder, have you? You haven't even talked to him. So, getting caught at the FBI... winning our trust was all towards one thing. It was only to get to William.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: Sitting here, you'd wish me dead. Shortly, I'll do you the favour.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I had this checked. It's an unknown metal that you injected into my son.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: It's a form of magnetite.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: A gift.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "A gift"?

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: Having failed as a conspirator to control alien colonization, my father wanted nothing more than to see the world fail, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what, you've prevented it now? You've... prevented alien colonization by injecting this metal into my son?

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: Your son is the one thing the aliens need. I took revenge on my father by taking William away from them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, he's all right now? I mean, just like that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, it's over. They'll let him be.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: It'll never be over. They'll always know what he was. They'll never accept what he is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I can protect him.

speaker: JEFFREY SPENDER
line: And if you can't? Look at me... what they did. Is this what you want for your son?

speaker: REYES
line: Dana... the room's all fresh for you. I threw out all the old bedding and bought some brand-new stuff, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: REYES
line: I know it's impossible to stop thinking about what he said about William... but it's all lies, Dana and you were the one who proved it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And how should I prove it now? By insisting that I can protect him... only to learn too late that I can't?

speaker: REYES
line: You say it as if you have a choice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He didn't have a choice to come into this life. I don't have a choice about what he is or was... but I do have a choice about the life my son will have...

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... And shouldn't I choose that he never have to be afraid of anyone or anything? And can I ever really even promise him that?

speaker: REYES
line: But who can?

speaker: DISSOLVE TO
line: nan

speaker: MR. VAN DE KAMP
line: ... in there. Look what I got. Big buffalo.

speaker: MR. VAN DE KAMP
line: Sweet dreams, baby boy.
